snippet: Jeff Price, the chief of TuneCore, a digital music distributor in Brooklyn, is a vocal gadfly who denounces the industry’s opaque accounting systems and sometimes insults companies he dislikes.
abstract: Jeff Price, the chief of TuneCore, a digital music distributor in Brooklyn, is a vocal gadfly who denounces the industry’s opaque accounting systems and sometimes insults companies he dislikes; critics suggest he denigrates the music world's practices to get more clients, which he disputes; TuneCore represents about 10 percent of the 20 million songs on iTunes in the United States, and it accounts for almost 4 percent of all digital sales.
lead_paragraph: Jeff Price, the chief of TuneCore, a digital music distributor in Brooklyn, is a vocal gadfly who denounces the industry’s opaque accounting systems and sometimes insults companies he dislikes.

headline.seo: TuneCore Chief Shakes Up Music With His Own Words
headline.main: Out to Shake Up Music, Often With Sharp Words
headline.print_headline: Out to Shake Up Music, Often With Sharp Words
